thread.title: Saara Aalto dazzles on X Factor live tour in Nottingham | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Saara Aalto dazzles on X Factor live tour in Nottingham | Daily Mail Online

author: Jabeen Waheed For Mailonline
title: Saara Aalto dazzles on X Factor live tour in Nottingham | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 87 shares The European beauty wore her brunette locks into a braided side ponytail, which framed her striking features as she wowed audiences. It wasn't long before Saara changed into an exaggerated skater style red dress, which she teamed with silver-dotted fishnet tights. Up in the air: The Finish star impressively floated away on some balloons during her set Dazzling: Saara, who was also joined by the rest of last season's X Factor contestants, including the winner Matt Terry, oozed quirky glamour in the sensational one-piece Figure-flattering: The eye-catching garment flaunted her ample assets Girl squad: She performed with fellow contestants Emily Middlemas (L) and Sam Lavery (R) Silver lining: They all wowed in their matching ensembles Red hot: It wasn't long before Saara changed into an exaggerated skater style red dress A slick of red lipstick also served her well as she impressed her fans with her powerhouse vocals. Always keen on showing off her quirky side during the Simon Cowell spearheaded singing competition last year, Saara pulled out a party trick. Ensuring she was strapped into a barely visible security harness, the brave starlet 'floated' into the sky with four big balloons. Super cool: Ensuring she was strapped into a barely visible security harness, the brave starlet 'floated' into the sky with four big balloons. All eyes on her: Always keen on showing off her quirky side during the Simon Cowell spearheaded singing competition last year, Saara pulled out a party trick Scene stealer: Saara ensured all eyes were focused solely on her Complementing her performance: The talented starlet was joined by a bevy of back-up dancers Main attraction: The show's big winner Matt Terry looked every inch the handsome star in a black suit and white shirt, which boasted logos down the buttons Impressive: The Bromley born star proved why he had won the show as she wowed people with his smooth vocal ability Smooth: On one occasion the star got comfortable and sat on the edge of the stage Members of the audience watched on in awe as she headed above while portraying the illusion that she was only supported by the props. Meanwhile, the show's big winner Matt Terry looked every inch the handsome star in a black suit and white shirt, which boasted logos down the buttons. The Bromley born star proved why he had won the show as she wowed people with his smooth vocal ability. Entertainment: The season's most controversial act Honey G was also on hand to rap along to some of her tunes Loving it: The star, real name Anna Georgette Gilford, worked her charms on the crowd alongside her equally high-spirited back-up dancers Tomboy style: She also stuck to the silver theme with a stylish tracksuit set Trendy: Honey later changed into a black diamond encrusted number Teen star: Emily Middlemas looked super stylish in a velvet black mini-dress which featured a floral design on the upper half Style queen: In true fashionista form she completed the look with a cool hat, choker and boots The season's most controversial act Honey G was also on hand to rap along to some of her tunes. The entertaining star, real name Anna Georgette Gilford, worked her charms on the crowd alongside her equally high-spirited back-up dancers. Teen star Emily Middlemas looked super stylish in a velvet black mini-dress which featured a floral design on the upper half. Hunk: Emily's boyfriend Ryan Lawrie also looked every inch the rising star as he put on an incredibly energetic performance Putting on a performance: The Scottish singer donned a patchwork denim jacket, black ripped jeans and a headband as he got crouched down to relay the lyrics In true fashionista form she completed the look with a cool hat, choker and boots. Meanwhile, her boyfriend Ryan Lawrie also looked every inch the rising star as he put on an incredibly energetic performance. The Scottish singer donned a patchwork denim jacket, black ripped jeans and a headband as he got crouched down to relay the lyrics. 5 after Midnight looked handsome in all-white ensembles as they sung some of their favourite tunes from the series. White hot: 5 after Midnight looked handsome in all-white ensembles as they sung some of their favourite tunes from the series Touch of sophistication: Saara layer wrapped up in style with a chic slit blazer Statement: Saara also changed into a glittering black mini-dress while the back-up dancers emulated a cobweb around her Pins on parade! Saara's lean legs were on fine form in the striking number Share or comment on this article 87
